headline: Why Does Visa Continue to Sit at the Center of Digital Payments?
summary: V remains central to digital payments thanks to its massive global network, transaction-based model and expanding value-added services as cash use declines.

headline: This Week In Digital Payment - South Africa Embraces Cashless Revolution With Rapid Growth
summary: South Africa's digital payment landscape is experiencing significant growth, as highlighted by a report from EBC Financial Group. The rapid adoption of cashless transactions is fostering greater financial inclusion and economic participation, with card-based transactions projected to surpass ZAR2.9 trillion ($159 billion) by 2025. This growth is driven by increased merchant acceptance, advancements in contactless technology, and the proliferation of mobile-led payments. Moreover, the...

headline: Visa-Issued Crypto Card Spending Jumps 525% in 2025
summary: Spending through Visa-issued crypto cards surged in 2025, with total net transaction volume rising 525% over the year, signaling growing consumer use of crypto-linked payment products for everyday purchases. Key Takeaways: Visa-issued crypto card spending jumped 525% in 2025, pointing to rising everyday use of crypto-linked payments. EtherFi led all ...

headline: How Visa’s AI Commerce Tie-Up With Fiserv Will Impact Visa (V) Investors
summary: In December 2025, Fiserv announced a collaboration with Visa to roll out Visa Intelligent Commerce and the Trusted Agent Protocol across Fiserv’s merchant ecosystem, aiming to secure and authenticate AI-driven “agentic” transactions. This partnership could make Visa a core infrastructure provider for automated, AI-led shopping experiences by tying its authentication and tokenization services directly into a large, existing merchant network. Next, we’ll examine how Visa’s Trusted Agent...
